body.description: The distinctly modern style and elegance of this Lucia 20-Piece Cutlery Set by Mikasa brings a touch of sophistication to any dining occasion. Beautifully crafted of 18/10 stainless steel, this collection features a sleek design, with clean lines and angles defining lean, understated handles that widen to a square-edged tip. A smooth, polished finish adds a gentle shine to your tabletop display. 20-piece set, service for 4, includes: 4 each of dinner fork, dinner spoon, dinner knife, salad fork, and teaspoon. Dishwasher safe.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: What is 18/10 Stainless Steel? A majority of Mikasa patterns are 18/10, which means that 18% chromium and 10% nickel have been added to the basic alloy. The high nickel content gives the steel a warm, soft luster and the chromium adds strength and resistance. Stainless steel is affordable, durable, needs no special care, is dishwasher safe and withstands harsh detergents. Under proper care and use, our flatware has superb resistance to staining from almost all foods and household substances and will not need to be polished. Mikasa Flatware A table setting is incomplete without flatware A beautifully set table is a sight to behold and a time-honored tradition. Whether you want to make everyday dining extraordinary or to create a one-of-a-kind tablescape for a special event, setting your table with Mikasa flatware will make a striking addition to your dinning experience. Available in a wide range of patterns and finishes, Mikasa's distinctive flatware collections will coordinate perfectly with your Mikasa dinnerware. Tarnish-Resistant Strong and Durable Dishwasher Safe

Expanded Sets for Entertaining Available in a wide range of beautiful patterns in a variety of configurations, larger Mikasa Flatware sets include serving utensils or storage caddies for even more entertaining possibilities. So, whether your setting your table for family dinner or entertaining a large crowd for the holidays, you'll have all the right flatware. Never Needs Polishing Crafted using the highest quality 18/10 Stainless Steel, Mikasa Flatware is guaranteed to keep its lustrous shine for years to come. With proper use and care, our flatware will resistance staining from virtually all foods and household substances and will not need to be polished. Entertaining Tip Mikasa Flatware patterns coordinate perfectly with our collections of casual and formal dinnerware and glassware patterns like Italian Countryside, Cheers and Platinum Crown. The beauty of our classic designs means that you can use your Mikasa flatware everyday, for every occasion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High End Feel and Looks Great!
reviews.reviewText: It's Mikasa brand. I found the weight to be quite nice; meaning there was sturdiness and heaviness to the utensils. The feel was smooth and didn't "cut into" the fingers.I bought these for my elderly mother-in-law's home because she has downsized a bit and I remembered she had less than 4 place settings worth of everyday eating utensils. That just wasn't going to work for hubby and me with a recently unplanned and indefinite stay in her home. I have become accustomed to the 20+ year old sets of Guy DeGrenne flatware and have tried the cheaper sets. Mikasa has been a brand familiar to me, but I hadn't purchased before. I am truly impressed with this $50ish four place set!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This flatware (Lucia) is nice. I like simple, clean designs and substantial feeling flatware. This meets those points well. The very smooth handles look classic and match almost exactly a much more expensive set I have. The weight is just right, heavier than cheap flatware, but not so heavy as to be awkward. I will buy another set.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This set is probably the best flatware set that we’ve had. We always were the ones to purchase cheap sets and at some point replace them but never get around to it lol. I was familiar with Mikasa and found these here on sale for about $30. This was the perfect price as we had just moved and our budget wasn’t much. These were really nice though. We placed them in the dishwasher when we received them and they didn’t rust. I love the design and weight of the flatware They’re also very sturdy. I highly recommend these especially if you can find them on sale like we did. You won’t be disappointed!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I'm satisfied with my purchase, nice quality and design

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful set. Fork issue- but customer service helped!
reviews.reviewText: UPDATE: Mikasa did get back to me to ask for an address to mail me a replacement fork. YAY- thank you!Other than my one fork issue- the set is beautiful and solid. (Obviously, I love it if I purchased three sets.)I have two other sets and love them. This set came with a defective salad fork- the edge tine was shorter and VERY sharp. I contacted the manufacturer for one salad fork replacement because I could not contact seller- they NEVER responded. So disappointing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice weight and feel, but LARGE forks
reviews.reviewText: I just received the Lucia version of the Mikasa flatware. It really looks and feels quite nice. The weight is good (relatively heavy and weighted well). And the design has nice simplicity.However, I am not sure if I will keep it or send it back. The reason is the forks. The dinner fork has VERY long/ big prongs. While it makes them look fancy, I feel like I would be eating with a pitch-fork, given the size!!The salad forks are large for salad forks, too - the size of the fork part is almost identical to my current dinner forks. The only difference is a slightly shorter handle.Of note, the overall length of the dinner fork is the same as my current dinner fork - it is just the size of the prongs that are the issue.If this is something you like or want in flatware, then you will like this set. Otherwise, perhaps consider a set with smaller pronged forks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love love love these!!!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I’ve been looking for a good set of flatware they were nice and sturdy and good quality. I had bought some years ago at a department store and piece by piece. They have disappeared. I shopped for a long time before I finally settled on these. When I found these, I was so excited. They feel wonderful in the hand they’re not flimsy they will not bend easily. They are very substantial and high-quality. It’s strange to think that I get so excited about flatware, but I absolutely love these! You won’t be disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Long Story About Our Purchase of this Mikasa Swirl 20-Piece Flatware Set
reviews.reviewText: For the past twenty-five years, we have been using 18/8 stainless flatware made by the Wallace company. The name of the pattern is “Tiara” and, in my opinion, it looks as nice today as it did when we bought it.Unfortunately, about 10 years ago, my wife announced that she “was tired of it” and that it was time to buy a new set.Frankly, I saw no reason to do this, but, keeping in the spirit of “a Happy Wife Means a Happy Life,” I agreed that we should look for something new.Now, for the most part, we agree on most things we purchase for our house, but we just could not agree on a flatware pattern.The problem is that I prefer satin-finished flatware and she abhors it!As our former set was shiny, I thought that it would be nice to have a satin-finish now.So, for the past ten (10) years, we have been visiting all sorts of stores where stainless flatware is sold but, primarily, we have searched in that “famous” store called B B & B (you know, the one which sends out all those 20%-off coupons).FINALLY, couple of weeks ago, we were in B B & B (armed with plenty of those coupons) and we saw this Mikasa Swirl 20-Piece Flatware Set .It wasn’t “exactly” my wife's choice, nor was is it “exactly” mine – but we agreed that, after all this time, a compromise was in order, especially in view of the fact that we both liked this set. She likes "shiny" and I like "satin" and this set has both.Now B B & B does not keep this set in stock so we had to order it. We ordered two sets, a total of service for 8 (we have NEVER had more than 6 people for dinner including us).We thought that that amount would be fine.Later, when we got home from the store, my wife suggested that we check to see, a) if Amazon sells it, and, b) at what price.I did so and saw that Amazon does indeed sell it and I was gratified to see that Amazon’s price was much higher than B B & B’s price. My wife was happy too.The sets arrived three days after we had placed the order, we packed away the old Wallace set (I insisted that we keep it as there is absolutely nothing wrong with it), and washed the new set in our dishwasher.As expected, all of the pieces emerged in good order. The satin portion was not damaged in any way (something that my wife feared would happen with satin finishes) and the shiny portions were shiny indeed.As we have never experienced any rust on any 18/8 stainless set we have owned in the past, we do not anticipate any forming on this Mikasa 18/10 set (18/8 and 18/10 are virtually identical in quality).But then, after just a few days of ownership, my wife announced that, as we had had service for 16 of the Wallace set, we must have service for 16 of this new set.As I mentioned above, we have never had more than 6 people at our dining-room table, but that argument fell on deaf ears. She DECREED that I must order one more set, thereby giving us service for 12 (that was her “compromise”).Before going out to the store, I decided to check Amazon once more (after all, their prices change all the time).WOW! The price had dropped $30.00 per set! This was well below what we had paid in B B & B.I told my wife this and she said that we should order two more sets of 4-place servings, thereby giving us the service for 16 we had had previously.I did this and, two days later (thank you Amazon Prime!), the sets arrived.Now she is a happy lady indeed!I have to say that we are very pleased with this stainless. It is obviously very well-made and it is heavy, much heavier than our previous Wallace set. The heft is superb. The teaspoons and the tablespoons are larger than any which either of us had ever seen before. The knives are very sharp and cut neatly through anything we have tried so far. The forks are equally superb.I have to tell you that if we hadn’t seen it in the store, we probably would have never bought it. You just can’t tell from a picture, no matter how detailed, how a set of flatware will look or how it will feel in the hand.So, if you are in the market for a new set of flatware, I suggest that you go to a store which sells Mikasa flatware and see for yourself. Then you can come home and order it from Amazon (though, in the spirit of fairness, it might be nice to buy just one set of 4 from the store and any more sets from Amazon).Personally, I think that you will like this Mikasa Swirl flatware as much as we do.Here’s a little tidbit: if, forty years ago, you would have told me that I would be buying stainless flatware which was made in Vietnam, I would have told you that you were nuts! But there it is. That’s where this flatware is made (our previous Wallace set was made in Korea).Now I am quite certain that I will not be around in twenty-five years (though it’s possible that my wife will be) so I am also quite certain that this is the last set of stainless flatware that I shall ever purchase.But that’s all right. Both my wife and I are very pleased with this Mikasa Swirl flatware and I know that I shall never “get tired” of it. I hope that my wife feels the same way.I can very highly recommend it to you as it has brought “happiness” to our house.I thank you for reading this.Lawrence H. BulkP.S. If my wife ever does "get tired" of this set, she can always go back to that Wallace one. I'm NEVER going to buy another flatware set as long as I live! So there!
Bought this set for my picnic basket. Substantial quality

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this Mikasa and the syle is sophisicated
reviews.reviewText: I bought one set of four just to take a look at how they looked on my table and how they cleaned up in the dishwasher.I love them..in fact I bought 2 more sets of 4, making my complete set of 12. They are a silky stainless steel and really do look lovely.This style also worked for me because when I am setting the table as in a modern look, they really garner the compliments.Sam
